page.title: 17Blandford Camp
page.content: Major Harfield author of'Blandford & the Military'met us at the camp.We noticed'Mercury'on a picture.He was standing on a globe.Mercury was the winged messenger of the Greek Gods & he was chosen as the Royal Corps Signals emblem in 1875 because they send messages all over the world.A 1000 officers & soldiers & 370 staff (civilian) work there now.Building of the present day camp started in 1963 & the School of Signals moved here in 1967.Racedown Road reminds us of the old Blandford Race Course.We got off the minibus in a Car Park surrounded by trees.We walked through a field of yellow flowers.We saw the gymnasium, medical centre,NAAFI shop & Garrison Church.We ended up in the Museum where we noticed the old Cable Wagon drawn by a six horse team.
